intro: Eremogone stenomeres, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eremogone, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, this plant has adapted to thrive in harsh, dry environments. Its root system is deep and extensive, allowing it to access water from lower soil layers. The plant is often found in rocky soils and is considered a hardy, drought-tolerant species.
